At Ancestry.com is an [[United States|American]] [[actress]] who has primarily worked in [[Television program|television]]. Clarke is best known for playing Faith Taylor on the daytime drama ''[[Days of our Lives]]'', the manipulative and cunning [[Julie Cooper-Nichol]] on ''[[The O.C.]]'', and the professional dominatrix [[Lady Heather]] on ''[[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation|CSI]]''. She currently portrays the role of Amanda on the television series ''[[Nikita (TV series)|Nikita]]''. == Biography == === Personal life === Clarke was born in [[Dana Point, California]], the daughter of Patricia Lewis, a ballet dancer, and [[John Clarke (actor)|John Clarke]], an actor who was an original cast member of the daytime soap opera ''[[Days of Our Lives]]''.[http://www.filmreference.com/film/97/Mindy-Clarke.html Mindy Clarke Biography ((?)-)] She has a brother, Joshua, and a sister, Heidi, who died in 1994 of a malignant heart tumor. [http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800334807/bio Melinda Clarke Biography - Yahoo! Movies] She has a daughter named Catherine Grace. === Career === Clarke appeared on the daytime soap opera ''[[Days of Our Lives]]'' as Faith Brown (where her father was a senior cast member), and starred on ''[[Soldier of Fortune, Inc.]]'' for both of its seasons. She also guest starred on ''[[Xena: Warrior Princess]]'' as the [[Amazons|Amazon]] chieftain [[Velasca]], ''[[Firefly (TV series)|Firefly]]'' as the brothel madam Nandi, ''[[Siren Song|Charmed]]'' as the Siren, and has had six appearances on ''[[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation|CSI]]'' where she played the [[dominatrix]], [[Lady Heather]]. She also appeared in the ''[[Seinfeld]]'' episode "[[The Muffin Tops]]", playing Jerry's girlfriend who likes anything hairless. She appeared on the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX]] drama ''The O.C.'' as [[Julie Cooper]], a cunning socialite who marries for money. Her character in the show is mainly potrayed as a mulipulative, morally-wrong woman, but as the show progresses you begin to understand why she makes her choices. She was originally billed as a guest star in the first few episodes, and due to fan response was offered a series regular contract; Clarke accepted the role and her character became an integral part of the show's storylines. As well as starring on ''The O.C.'', she has appeared on HBO's hit series ''[[Entourage (TV series)|Entourage]]'' as a fictionalized version of herself, married to [[Malcolm McDowell]]'s Terrance McQuewick. Clarke also appeared as the Devil's girlfriend in [[The CW Television Network|The CW]]'s 2007 series ''[[Reaper (TV series)|Reaper]]''. She also auditioned for the role of "[[Number Six (Battlestar Galactica)|Number Six]]" on SCI-FI's smash hit ''[[Battlestar Galactica (2004 TV series)|Battlestar Galactica]]'' but the role ultimately went to [[Tricia Helfer]].''Battlestar Galactica: The Official Companion'' In 2010, she appeared on [[the CW]] show ''[[The Vampire Diaries (TV series)|The Vampire Diaries]]'' as Kelly Donovan.{{cite news | first=Michael | last=Ausiello | title='Vampire Diaries' exclusive: Melinda Clarke is the mom from hell! | date=January 8, 2010 | url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2010/01/08/vampire-diaries-melinda-clarke-matt-mom | work=Entertainment Weekly | accessdate=April 13, 2010}} Other projects included a TV movie, ''She Drives Me Crazy'', which was produced by her former ''The O.C.'' co-star [[Kelly Rowan]]. She appeared as a guest star on ''[[Chuck (TV series)|Chuck]]'', another series from ''The O.C.'' creator [[Josh Schwartz]]. She plays Amanda, a series regular role, on The CW's drama ''[[Nikita (2010 TV series)|Nikita]]''. She has also lent her voice to several voice acting projects, voicing Alexa in ''[[The Animatrix#Matricluated|The Animatrix: Matricluated]]'', Sofia Ivanescu in the video game ''[[Mission Impossible: Operation Surma]]'', Madame Macmu-Ling in ''[[Avatar: The Last Airbender]]'' and Charlene in ''[[King of the Hill]]''.
